Body:
It's not an online resource, but NLTK provides several ways to get measures of semantic similarity:

  • Several Wordnet-based options. Many of them are based on the path distance between synsets in the Wordnet graph. Many words obviously occur in more than one synset, so you need to choose at least a part of speech.
  • nltk.corpus.reader.lin which provides distributional similarity measures drawn from some large corpus. I've never been able to find a proper citation for this distributional thesaurus, but it appears to be related to Identifying Synonyms among Distributionally Similar Words, Lin et al. 2003.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: Computational lexicographer, working toward a focus on computational lexical semantics.
